name: Electrical Panel Upgrade (100A to 200A)
description: Is your home still running on a 100-amp electrical panel? Modern South Florida homes demand more power than ever—between central air conditioning, electric vehicles, home offices, and smart home technology, outdated panels simply can't keep up. Solomon Electric specializes in upgrading residential electrical panels from 100A to 200A, providing the capacity your home needs while meeting all Florida electrical codes and utility requirements.
features: New code-compliant panel with labeled breakers
warningSignsHeading: Signs Your 100-Amp Panel Needs an Upgrade
warningSignsSubheading: Your electrical panel is the heart of your home's power system. These warning signs indicate it's time to upgrade to 200 amps.

problems.title: Frequently Tripping Breakers
problems.description: When breakers trip regularly—especially when running AC, appliances, or multiple devices—your panel can't handle the load. This is the #1 sign you've outgrown 100 amps.

problems.title: Planning an EV Charger Installation
problems.description: Level 2 EV chargers require 40-50 amps of dedicated capacity. Most 100-amp panels don't have room for this addition without overloading the system.

problems.title: Home Addition or Major Renovation
problems.description: Adding square footage, a pool, hot tub, or second AC unit requires additional electrical capacity that 100-amp service typically cannot provide.

problems.title: Outdated or Recalled Panel Brands
problems.description: Federal Pacific, Zinsco, and certain Pushmatic panels are known fire hazards. Insurance companies often require replacement regardless of capacity.

problems.title: Fuse Box Instead of Circuit Breakers
problems.description: If your home still has screw-in fuses, you're decades behind modern safety standards. Fuse boxes cannot be safely upgraded—complete replacement is required.

problems.title: Insurance or Sale Requirements
problems.description: Many insurance companies won't cover homes with panels older than 30 years. Real estate transactions often require panel certification or upgrade before closing.

process.title: Load Calculation & Evaluation
process.description: We assess your current and future electrical needs—existing appliances, planned additions, EV chargers, pool equipment—to ensure 200 amps truly fits your situation.

process.title: Permit & FPL Coordination
process.description: We handle all permit applications with your local building department and coordinate with Florida Power & Light for the required service upgrade and meter change.

process.title: Panel Installation Day
process.description: On installation day, FPL disconnects power in the morning. We remove your old panel, install the new 200-amp panel with properly labeled breakers, and prepare for reconnection.

process.title: Inspection & Final Approval
process.description: We coordinate the building department inspection. Once approved, FPL reconnects your service—typically the same day. Most upgrades are completed in 6-8 hours.

process.title: Documentation & Warranty
process.description: You receive all inspection documentation, warranty information, and a panel diagram showing each circuit. This documentation is valuable for insurance and future home sales.

benefits.title: Future-Proof Your Home
benefits.description: 200-amp service handles today's demands and tomorrow's additions. EV chargers, heat pumps, home additions, and smart home technology all require more power than older homes provide.

benefits.title: End Frustrating Breaker Trips
benefits.description: Stop walking to the garage every time you run the microwave and hair dryer together. Adequate capacity means your electrical system works invisibly, as it should.

benefits.title: Insurance & Resale Value
benefits.description: Updated electrical panels are a major selling point. Many insurance companies offer better rates for homes with modern 200-amp panels and whole-home surge protection.

benefits.title: Enhanced Safety
benefits.description: Modern panels include better overcurrent protection, ground fault capability, and arc-fault detection options that older panels simply don't offer.

faqs.question: Does my Miami home need a 200-amp panel upgrade?
faqs.answer: If your home still has a fuse box, a Federal Pacific (FPE) or Zinsco panel, or if your breakers trip frequently when using appliances, you likely need an upgrade. Insurance companies often require replacing panels older than 30 years. If you're planning to add an EV charger, pool pump, or additional AC unit, 200-amp service is essential.

faqs.question: How long does a panel upgrade take?
faqs.answer: Most residential panel upgrades from 100A to 200A are completed in one day—typically 6-8 hours from FPL disconnect to power restoration. We coordinate with FPL to minimize your outage time.

faqs.question: Will I need a permit for a new electrical panel?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Florida law requires permits for panel changes. We handle all permit applications with your local building department (Miami-Dade, Broward, or municipal) and coordinate the required inspection. Never hire an electrician who suggests skipping permits—it's illegal and can void your insurance.

faqs.question: How much capacity do I need for an EV charger?
faqs.answer: Level 2 EV chargers typically require a 40-50 amp circuit. With a 200-amp panel, you'll have plenty of capacity for EV charging plus future additions. We can install your EV charger circuit during the panel upgrade for maximum efficiency.

faqs.question: What's wrong with Federal Pacific or Zinsco panels?
faqs.answer: These panel brands have documented failure rates where breakers don't trip during overcurrent conditions—the exact moment they're supposed to protect your home from fire. While not officially recalled, they're widely considered fire hazards. Most insurance companies require replacement. We recommend upgrading these panels regardless of age.

faqs.question: Does FPL need to be involved in my panel upgrade?
faqs.answer: Yes. Panel upgrades require FPL to disconnect power, install a new meter base, and reconnect service. We coordinate all FPL scheduling as part of our service—you don't need to make separate arrangements.

faqs.question: Will upgrading my panel increase my electricity bill?
faqs.answer: No. A larger panel doesn't use more electricity—it simply provides more capacity for when you need it. Your bill is based on consumption, not panel size. In fact, if you're currently causing breakers to trip and then running extra cycles on appliances, you might actually see slight savings.

faqs.question: Can you upgrade my panel if I live in a condo?
faqs.answer: Condo panel upgrades are more complex because they involve HOA approval, building electrical infrastructure, and sometimes FPL coordination for the entire building. We specialize in South Florida condo electrical work and can assess whether an upgrade is possible in your situation.

seoContent.heading: Professional 200-Amp Panel Upgrades in South Florida
seoContent.body: Solomon Electric is South Florida's trusted provider of residential electrical panel upgrades. Our licensed electricians specialize in upgrading older 100-amp panels to modern 200-amp service—providing the capacity your family needs for air conditioning, electric vehicles, home offices, and all the electrical demands of contemporary living. We serve Miami-Dade, Broward, and Palm Beach counties.

seoContent.heading: Why South Florida Homes Need 200-Amp Service
seoContent.body: Florida homes face unique electrical demands. Year-round air conditioning, pool pumps, dehumidifiers, and hurricane season power needs quickly overwhelm 100-amp panels that were standard in homes built before 2000. Add an EV charger, home office equipment, or kitchen renovation, and you'll exceed safe capacity. Upgrading to 200 amps eliminates these constraints while adding modern safety features.

seoContent.heading: FPL Coordination & Permit Handling
seoContent.body: Panel upgrades in Florida require coordination with your utility company and local building department. Solomon Electric handles everything—permit applications, FPL scheduling, inspection coordination, and final documentation. Our 100% inspection pass rate means your project won't face delays from code violations or incomplete work.

seoContent.heading: Trusted Electrical Panel Experts Since 2008
seoContent.body: With over 500 panel upgrades completed across South Florida, Solomon Electric has the experience to handle any residential electrical panel project. Our Florida State Licensed electricians (License #EC13012419) provide honest assessments, quality installations, and clear communication throughout your project. We serve Miami, Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Pembroke Pines, Coral Springs, and all surrounding communities.
